title: Llyn Llech Owain Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Trevor Rickard / Llyn Lech Owain
images.caption: The north-west corner of the lake is covered in water lilies.

images.title: Trevor Rickard / Heathland north of Llyn Llech Owain
images.caption: Heathland north of the park. Looking northwards towards Afon Tywi in the distance. This area has a bird hide just off to the left for viewing rare species.

images.title: Llyn Llech Owain from the Dedication Plaque by Nigel Davies, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: From the Dedication Plaque

description: Enjoy waterside paths and woodland trails in this 158-acre country park in Carmarthenshire. The well surfaced paths take you alongside the large lake and then into the surrounding woodland. The park is also open to cyclists with an easy forest track and a more challenging mountain bike trail to try.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a decent on site cafe where you can enjoy refreshments after your exercise.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland trails in the park are ideal for dog walking. It's a popular place so you'll probably meet other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles south west of the park you can pick up the Swiss Valley Cycle Route at Tumble. The route will take you to the Swiss Valley Reservoir before heading to the Millennium Coastal Park in Llanelli. To the north there's the splendid Dinefwr Park in Llandeilo. There's an historic 12th century castle and an 18th century landscaped park to see here. Near here there's also Gelli Aur Country Park. The park surrounds the Golden Grove mansion and includes a deer park, peacocks, views of the Tywi Valley and an aboretum with some fine specimen trees. A few miles north east of Llandeilo there's the climb to the viewpoint and two Iron Age Hill Forts on Garn Goch. To the east is Ammanford where you can enjoy nice trails through the River Amman Valley and pick up the Heart of Wales Line Trail.

display_address: Church Road, Gorslas, Sir Gaerfyrddin / Carmarthenshire, Cymru / Wales, SA14 7NF, United Kingdom
